Are the two triangles shown below congruent?

[[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

(a).[[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('jxgbox', { boundingbox: [-6, 7, 6, -1], axis: false, showNavigation: false, showCopyright: false }); // Points with labels only (no circles), labels positioned outside var A = board.create('point', [0, 3], { name: 'A', fixed: true, visible: false, label: {offset: [0, 15], visible: true, fontSize: 14} // above point }); var B = board.create('point', [-2.5, 2], { name: 'B', fixed: true, visible: false, label: {offset: [-15, -10], visible: true, fontSize: 14} // left below }); var C = board.create('point', [2.5, 0], { name: 'C', fixed: true, visible: false, label: {offset: [15, -10], visible: true, fontSize: 14} // right below }); // Triangle sides var AB = board.create('segment', [A, B]); var AC = board.create('segment', [A, C]); var BC = board.create('segment', [B, C]); // Angles inside the triangle board.create('angle', [B, A, C], { // Angle at A radius: 0.6, withLabel: true, name: '100°', label: {offset: [0, 0], fontSize: 12} }); board.create('angle', [C, B, A], { // Angle at B radius: 0.8, withLabel: true, name: '40°', label: {offset: [0, 0], fontSize: 12} }); board.create('angle', [A, C, B], { // Angle at C radius: 0.8, withLabel: true, name: '40°', label: {offset: [0, 0], fontSize: 12} }); // Side length labels board.create('text', [1.0, 2.0, '9 cm'], {fontSize: 12}); // AC board.create('text', [-1.0, 1.1, '7 cm'], {fontSize: 12}); // AB board.create('text', [-1.6, 2.6, '5 cm'], {fontSize: 12}); // BC [[/jsxgraph]] (b) [[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('jxgbox', { boundingbox: [-6, 7, 6, -1], axis: false, showNavigation: false, showCopyright: false }); // Points with labels only (no circles), labels positioned outside var P = board.create('point', [0, 3], { name: 'P', fixed: true, visible: false, label: {offset: [0, 15], visible: true, fontSize: 14} }); var Q = board.create('point', [-2.5, 2], { name: 'Q', fixed: true, visible: false, label: {offset: [-15, -10], visible: true, fontSize: 14} }); var R = board.create('point', [2.5, 0], { name: 'R', fixed: true, visible: false, label: {offset: [15, -10], visible: true, fontSize: 14} }); // Triangle sides var PQ = board.create('segment', [P, Q]); var PR = board.create('segment', [P, R]); var QR = board.create('segment', [Q, R]); // Angles inside the triangle board.create('angle', [Q, P, R], { // Angle at P radius: 0.6, withLabel: true, name: '100°', label: {offset: [0, 0], fontSize: 12} }); board.create('angle', [R, Q, P], { // Angle at Q radius: 0.8, withLabel: true, name: '40°', label: {offset: [0, 0], fontSize: 12} }); board.create('angle', [P, R, Q], { // Angle at R radius: 0.8, withLabel: true, name: '40°', label: {offset: [0, 0], fontSize: 12} }); // Side length labels (substituted) board.create('text', [1.5, 1.5, '7 cm'], {fontSize: 12}); // PR (was 9) board.create('text', [-0.6, 1.7, '5 cm'], {fontSize: 12}); // PQ (was 7) board.create('text', [1.6, 3.4, '9 cm'], {fontSize: 12}); // QR (was 5) // --- Rotation Function --- function rotatePoint(p, angleDeg, center) { var angleRad = angleDeg * Math.PI / 180; var x = p.X() - center[0]; var y = p.Y() - center[1]; var xNew = x * Math.cos(angleRad) - y * Math.sin(angleRad) + center[0]; var yNew = x * Math.sin(angleRad) + y * Math.cos(angleRad) + center[1]; p.setPosition(JXG.COORDS_BY_USER, [xNew, yNew]); } // Rotation center (around point P) var center = [P.X(), P.Y()]; // Rotate each point 60° anticlockwise rotatePoint(P, 60, center); rotatePoint(Q, 60, center); rotatePoint(R, 60, center); [[/jsxgraph]]
